articles.title: Former Aurora priest remains in ICE custody pending removal to Colombia
articles.description: A former Aurora priest who avoided a jury trial on child sex abuse charges through a misdemeanor plea deal Friday remains in Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody pending voluntary deportation to his home country of Colombia. As of Monday evening, Alfre…

articles.title: September 13, 1814: Key pens Star-Spangled Banner
articles.description: On this day in 1814, Francis Scott Key pens a poem which is later set to music and in 1931 becomes America’s national anthem, “The Star-Spangled Banner.” The poem, originally titled “The Defence of Fort McHenry,” was written after Key witnessed the Maryland f…

articles.author: Stephen Gossett
articles.title: Trump Administration Is Scouting For An Immigration Detention Site In Chicago Area
articles.description: ICE earlier this month put forth requests to identify possible new immigration detention sites in multiple cities, including the Chicago area. [ more › ]
